newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: ACCC says two weeks to Westpac bid ruling.
newsitem.headline: ACCC says two weeks to Westpac bid ruling.

text.p: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) said on Friday it was two weeks away from ruling on Westpac Banking Corp's bid for Bank of Melbourne Ltd (BML).
"We are still working on it. It should be finished in about two weeks," said a spokeswoman for the corporate regulator.
Sydney-based Westpac, one of Australia's big four banks, announced its A$1.435 billion friendly bid for the Victorian regional bank in early April.
The ACCC has the power to veto any mergers it believed inhibited competition and Australian Treasurer Peter Costello has the additional power to veto bank acquisitions and mergers.

Costello has said that he would be guided in the exercise of his discretion by the commission's guidelines that have previously blocked mergers that would eliminate the last major regional bank in a state.
Westpac has said its planned takeover of BML was integral to its strategy of strengthening its presence in several key markets.
